column1: starts off by drifting onto the left-hander's legs, tucked away to fine leg for one

Here's some inswing to the right-handed Finch. Nice length, and he's pinned to the crease, playing across his front pad, but it's swinging down leg as well as hitting too high - around the top of his thigh - and the ball rolls into the point region enabling a leg-bye
back of a length outside off, poked away into the point region
back of a length, swerving away mildly in the corridor, gets on the back foot and defends, playing besides the line rather than behind it
once again, back of a length in the corridor. Dabbed to backward point with soft hands
fuller now, swinging away from a middle and off line. Jabs down uncertainly without really getting forward, and gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
length ball slanting away into the fifth-stump channel. Left alone
fullish, on the pads, and that's clipped away neatly to the left of square leg and it runs away quickly to the short square boundary
fullish, slanting away from off stump. Nice stride forward, waits on it, and guides it down to third man
length ball, finds some inswing to beat the inside edge of Finch's flick and hit him on the pad. Muted appeal - he knew it was sliding down leg
lovely length, inviting the cover drive but not quite pitched right up for it. Flashes hard at it with an angled bat and he's lucky not to have edged it
nice length again, a little closer to off stump. Left alone
back of a length, misses his line and ends up drifting marginally down leg. Carey misses the tuck off his hip and the umpire signals wide
again the line starts from outside leg stump. Looks to flick and can't connect, the front pad comes in the way
this one is slanted a long way across and pitched nice and full. Chases away from his body, goes for the angled-bat drive, and fails to connect
angled across again, pitching on about off stump and continuing to leave the batsman. This time Carey shoulders arms
back of a length, finishing on around off stump, gets nicely behind it to defend it back towards the bowler
length ball pitching on off and slanting further away, left alone
fullish, angling across to off stump, defended off the front foot to mid-on
length ball, finishing on top of off, hits high on the inside half of the bat as Finch defends half-forward, towards midwicket
fullish on off stump, picks up a single with a checked drive to the left of mid-off
beauty. Length ball slanting across Carey, pitching within the stumps and forcing him to play a forward defensive. Leaves him slightly off the pitch to beat the outside edge
length ball on off stump, pushed towards mid-off with soft hands and they sprint a quick single
length ball close to off stump, punched towards mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended with an open face towards backward point
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away quietly into the square leg region

ooh, again Finch gets in trouble with his front pad going across. A good length, swinging in late towards off stump, and Finch pulls his pad away at the last moment to defend with a straight bat, back towards the bowler
a touch straighter, tucked away to fine leg
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away into the backward square leg region
length ball outside off, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot to defend it back down the pitch, towards the non-striker
back of a length close to off stump, uses his wrists at the top of the bounce to play it back down the pitch
length ball slanting a long way across, left alone
full on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
good stop by Karthik at short extra-cover. Good length, a tiny bit of width, and Carey drives firmly on the up. Karthik dives to his left and parries it away
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, punched on the up through cover point. Biggish gap between backward point and cover
fullish, angling into the stumps, flicked to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, punched into the covers
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to tuck it to the left of square leg
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and drops it gently into the cover point region to pick up one
length ball homing in on the top of off stump. Finch brings his bat down nice and straight, full face showing, to block it back to the bowler

bowled him! Not the greatest shot Aaron Finch has played. This one's full, and Bhuvneshwar gets it to swing back in late. Finch goes for the big booming hit over mid-on, and only manages an inside-edge into his stumps. That shot was a result of all the pressure Bhuvneshwar and Shami have created with their lines to Finch. They've given him nothing in his areas today
fullish, angling into a fourth-stump line. Steered towards third man with an open face
back of a length, pitching outside leg. Looks to flick and misses, and is hit on the pad

nice length, pitching on off and continuing to angle away, and Carey's response is even better. The moment of weight transfer onto the front foot is just perfect, and he basically just meets it with the full face of his bat to send it racing between mid-off and extra-cover

and Shami responds with a perfectly directed bouncer. This is great bowling from the two quicks. Angling across, and Carey looks to hook - he has to work against the angle, and meet the ball in front of his back shoulder. Can't get on top of it, and only manages to balloon it in the air towards midwicket, where Dhawan takes a couple of steps forward and pouches it safely
bouncer first up, rising steeply over middle and leg, and Marsh has to jerk his front shoulder away from the line in a hurry
shortish, a bit of width, doesn't quite come on to the bat and Marsh has to check himself and chop it into the ground, towards backward point
fullish on middle and off, a tiny bit of swing away from Khawaja, who stays on the back foot and defends into the covers
nice length, slanting away from off stump. Khawaja is a little late getting on the front foot to drive, and Kohli throws himself to his left at gully to stop the thick edge from running away
back of a length, close to off stump, gets back and across to punch to cover point
length ball slanting across towards off stump, uses his wrists to whip it to the left of mid-on
full on middle and leg, gets his front pad out of the way and shows the full face to block it back down the pitch
length ball pitching on off stump and continuing with the angle away. Left alone
starts with a shortish ball at the hips, tucked away towards fine leg
once again the line is leg-sidish. A little further down leg and Khawaja can't connect with the tuck off the hip
on the pads again and Khawaja whips it away with a flourish, beats square leg to his left and there's no stopping it thereafter
back of a length, once again on leg stump, worked away to fine leg
and he gets his line right, angles this in towards the top of off stump. Marsh goes back and across to clip towards mid-on
full now, outside off, gets forward for a checked push to cover
fullish, angling into middle stump, clipped away wide of mid-on
back of a length outside off, comes off the pitch quite slow as he shapes to cut. Ends up chopping it hard into the ground, towards backward point
tossed up slow, wide of off stump, Marsh reaches out and plays a flat-bat drive to the left of deep point
back of a length outside off, sharp turn away from Marsh, who chooses to leave this alone
tossed up slow, turning from leg to off. Marsh gets forward, waits, and blocks it back to the bowler. He's bowling really slow today
another flighted ball on leg stump, clipped gently towards square leg
slow, short, a bit of width, slapped to sweeper cover
ooh, that's pretty quick, 139kph. Back of a length and slanting away from off stump. Jabs away from his body and is beaten
back of a length on middle and leg, lets it come on and plays with soft hands to keep it down into the leg side
length ball slanting across to off stump. Lets it come to him and dabs to backward point with an open face
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away through midwicket
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot and opens his bat face to ease it to backward point
fullish, close to off stump, Khawaja plays a checked drive to mid-off
shortish again, fairly wide, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length, wrong'un coming in towards off stump. Goes on the back foot and punches to long-off

ooh, that's lovely. So far Marsh has sat on the back foot comfortably and this time Kuldeep's flight draws him forward. Dips and spins away sharply to beat his outside edge as he looks to stab through the covers with an angled bat
back to that leg-stump line, worked into the leg side
full on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg
full on leg stump, whipped down the ground to long-on
short, down leg. Misses the pull and umpire Kettleborough signals wide
fullish outside off, Khawaja plays a forceful, wristy drive, straight to short extra-cover
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to deep square leg
short, slanting away from off stump, but the ball sits up nicely and Marsh can pull it well in front of square, roll his wrists over it, and easily beat deep square leg to his left
back of a length on off stump, defended towards backward point
back of a length on middle and off. Stays leg-side of the ball and runs it down to third man with an open face

shortish on middle stump - it's not a long-hop, and it only gets up to stump height, but Khawaja's a damn good puller, gets across his stumps and puts it away, with his front leg up in the air and a lovely whip of his wrists to give it impetus, beats deep square leg throwing himself to his left
down the pitch to the loopy off-stump ball. Meets it on the full and whips to deep midwicket
nicely flighted on off stump, Khawaja gets forward and defends into the off side
back of a length, pitching on off stump and straightening away. Punched to sweeper cover
flatter and quicker now. Fairly full but he plays the trajectory rather than the length. Goes back and across and defends it back to the bowler
down the track again, drives it hard and mid-on dives right to keep it down to one
shortish googly, goes deep in his crease and pulls to deep midwicket
138kph, short into the rips, he swivels and rolls the wrists on a pull shot, hitting it hard to fine leg
137kph, back of a length, angled across the left-hander, he guides this with an open face to third man
134kph, pushed too far wide of off, and called a wide
140kph, short ball outside off, he pulls but doesn't time it, through square leg to the man in the deep
cut hard in the air over backward point! 137kph, short and wide and Marsh thrashes his hands at it, carving it over backward point and it flies to the fence.
137kph, wide but a touch fuller, he's back and late cutting off the toe of the bat to third man
135kph, short on the hip and he cracks a pull shot, classical stroke with the front knee up, he placed it perfectly between fine leg and deep square!
looped up very full on middle, he shuffles out and yorks himself
short and wider, he late cuts, gets a top edge but it flies well wide of slip towards third man for a couple
78kph, full drifting into leg, he skips down and works this into the leg side but can't beat midwicket
again he's down the track whipping to midwicket
73kph, tossed up outside off, he dances down and drives fluently to long off

edged and it's dropped by Dhoni! It was shorter, he went back to cut, flashed hard, got a thickish edge, tough to handle, it bounces off Dhoni and ricochet's wide of slip! Hard to know if the edge was too much to react to
shorter on leg, he tucks it around the corner
fired down the leg side for a wide
shorter on leg, he turns it around the corner
shorter on leg, he pulls to the square leg on the circle
shorter down leg, he glances this nicely fine for a couple
91kph, shorter, spinning into off, he is back and punching off the back foot to cover-point
fuller on middle and off, he turns this with the spin through square leg to the sweeper
81kph. shorter leg break, he's back and cutting hard to deep cover
looped up, 73kph, he skips down and works this against the turn to midwicket

Khawaja might be run out! Jadeja with a direct hit. It's sent upstairs He's OUT! it was pushed through outside off, he chops a cut to cover-point and runs, Jadeja swoops to his left, gathers one-handed, takes one step and fires with a rocket to the non-striker's and hits! Khawaja was only centimetres out! Brilliant fielding for Jadeja
78kph, wrong un on off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
looped up, he skips down and drives to long on
wrong un outside off, he pushes out and defends
shorter outside off, he stands up and punches down to long on
shorter outside off, he's back and pushing this past cover, nicely placed and they get two
tossed up outside off, he is happy to leave this alone
93kph, tossed up closer to off, he drives on the front foot to long off
shorter, he cuts in the air but just short of short third man
fuller on off, he drives with the spin to long on
80kph, leg break, on middle and leg, he's back, it slides on, he chops down on it to cover
tossed up, he drives, bouncing it over cover for a couple
tossed up on off, he skips down and drives to long on
75kph, tossed up on off, he dances out and pushes this past the bowler to long on
looped up on off, he skips out and drives firmly to long off
75kph, shorter on off, he gives room and cuts with excellent timing and beats backward point! Nicely placed. Fast feet to get back and create the room. Great shot
94kph, short ball, he jumps on this length, he's back and pulling this over midwicket into the gap and one bounce over the rope!
fuller on middle and leg, he turns this behind square
shorter ball, he pulls over straight midwicket but wide long on is cutting this off, just the one
94kph, tossed up outside off, he drives easily to long off
91kph, angled into leg, he turns this behind square to the fielder in the circle
shorter on leg, he's back and whipping this off his thigh to deep forward square
138kph, fuller on leg, he clips this to wide mid on and takes one with the fielder set on the circle
138kph, shorter length on off, he is squared up on the back foot defending
128kph, fuller outside off, he mistimes a drive to cover
142kph, short ball, he swivels on the pull shot rolling this well wide of fine leg and DK runs around and makes a good diving save, but they get two
140kph, shorter outside off, he's back and running this off the face with a late cut to third man
140kph, on off, back of a length, he's back and chopping this off the inside edge just past leg stump! That wasn't far away, it rolled to fine leg
shorter length, he's back and pulling to midwicket, Kohli makes a good stop
tossed up, he skips out and drives to long on
90kph, tossed up, outside off, he drives down to long off
91kph, good length, he skips down and hammers a drive straight back past the bowler with power and beats wide long on who stood no chance! What a great shot
shorter on leg, he's back and working off the hip through square leg. 50 for Marsh. Two in a row. After a century against South Africa in November. He's played well in this format
tossed up outside off, he reaches out to drive mistiming this to cover
good length on off, he defends on the front foot to cover
back of a length on off, he's back and working this to midwicket
127kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot to cover-point
143kph, back of a length on leg, he's tucked up and forced to bunt it down into the leg side
141kph, full on his pads and Marsh loves this stuff, he clips this elegantly through forward square, it races across the outfield to the short boundary!
142kph, length ball outside off, he has big swipe across the line and misses
tossed up on leg, he turns this behind square leg for an easy one
shorter length on leg, he's back and tucking this through forward square
shorter on off, he's back and punching this straight back to Jadeja
fuller, pushed through on off, he drives towards long off and Jadeja gets in a tangle with Marsh meaning the ball could roll away for one
fired in on off, he defends on the front foot
95kph, good length outside off, he skips out and drives very nicely on the up against the turn past cover wide of long off for a couple
134kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to backward point
136kph, good length on off, he drives slices this as his bat came down across the line, back to the bowler
steps way outside off and glances this from off stump! It runs fine and races away, DK dives at fine leg but can't make the save!
135kph, fuller outside off, he square drives to deep point
good length wide of off, he tried to cut but mistimed it cover
short on the hip, 136kph, Marsh swivels and smacks this wide of fine leg for four! Too easy for Marsh. He is so quick on anything there
tossed up angled across, he drives straight to cover

Stumped! Slick from Dhoni! Handscomb tried to sweep a very full ball, was beaten by length, it spun past off, Dhoni takes it well, Handscomb's back foot is out of the crease, he didn't realise. Dhoni did. He whipped the bails off and Handscomb looked down and saw his foot was out!
full on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
a bit more flight, not as full. Comes forward to defend and he gets a thickish outside edge to backward point
length ball on off stump, blocked to short extra

lovely delivery, floats this one across the right-hander and pitches it outside off, inviting the drive into the covers. Stoinis isn't fully forward to it, and the ball dips on him and spins past his outside edge
full, slanting away into a wide-ish line outside off, driven to deep point
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, fairly wide outside off with a tiny bit of outswing. Reaches out to stab towards extra-cover

whoa, lovely delivery. Full, angling into the fifth-stump line from wide of the crease, and some late, late swing takes it past the outside edge as Stoinis goes for a hard-hands drive, aiming towards mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended to midwicket
wide of the crease again, fullish and anging into off stump. Clipped to deep midwicket
fullish, slanting across to pitch just outside off. Stretches out nicely to lap-sweep to the right of short fine leg
flat length ball close to off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
sharp spin from a middle-stump line. Beats the flick to hit the front pad. Easily missing leg, though
lovely quick feet out of the crease to the flighted ball on middle and off, clips it away through square leg
shortish, pitching on the stumps and turning a fair bit away to give Stoinis some width. Slapped to deep point
sharp turn again, heading down leg, Marsh opens up to whip it through square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched firmly to extra-cover

drifts onto the pads and that's sensational timing from Stoinis, basically just let it come to him and clips it away when it's right under his eyes. Fine leg didn't have a lot of distance to cover to his left but it was past him before he could even react
length ball on middle stump, shows the full face for a pushed single to mid-on
back of a length, close to off stump, lets it come to him and meets it when it's almost past him, with an adroitly angled blade, to help it down to third man
fullish outside off, sixth-stump line, left alone
back of a length, a little closer to off stump, punched to backward point
shortish outside off, slapped hard and Jadeja dives right at cover to make a good stop
back of a length, turning into the pads, goes deep in his crease to work it round to deep backward square leg
loops it up outside off and Marsh is out of his crease to squeeze a drive past the diving backward point fielder
back of a length, pitches on leg stump and he goes right back once more to work it with the spin through backward square leg
flighted ball on middle stump, nice stride forward to drive to long-on

length ball pitching on middle and off and turning towards leg. Shuffles across without coming forward or going back, and tickles it away into the fine leg region. Would have been worth an lbw shout if he'd missed
length ball slanting away from off stump, stays back to jab into the point region
back of a length, angling into off stump, goes back and across to tuck it away through square leg

length ball on middle and off and Marsh is a little slow taking off for the single after pushing to mid-off. Makes it easily in the end, not the smoothest of pick-ups and throws from Jadeja, for a change, and he misses the stumps too
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to short extra
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, jumps across to work it through square leg
floated up slow and full on off stump, driven back powerfully but too close to the bowler to profit from it
flighted lavishly once more and this time Stoinis looks to stay slightly leg-side of the ball and drive inside-out. Ends up slicing it into the point region
flatter, slanted across to a wide-ish line outside off. Not short enough to cut and Stoinis leaves it alone
tossed up outside off, stretches forward, waits, and dabs gently to the left of backward point

down the track - he's done this right through the innings, whenever he's seen it tossed up above his eyeline - and he skips away from the line just a little to give himself room to swing through a nice, clean arc and loft it flat, back over the bowler's head
once again some flight, driven along the ground this time to the right of long-on
back of a length, fifth-stump line, lets it come and jabs it into the cover point region to give the strike back to Marsh
back of a length on the pads, worked away to the right of long leg

ooh, nearly. Length ball close to off stump. Possibly didn't quite come on the way Marsh thought it would. Comes forward to knock a short single into the cover region, ends up inside-edging, on the bounce, past his leg stump

back of a length outside off, Stoinis shuffles across and out of his crease to get close to the ball and push into the covers. The fielder at short extra moves quickly to his left to cut off the single. Dhawan, I think
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length outside off, dabs it towards point with soft hands and gets that single he had been after for a while
shortish, pulled to deep midwicket from outside off stump
shot! Flat length ball outside off, and Marsh uses that bit of width expertly. Gets on the front foot, lets the ball come on, and cuts it late to beat backward point to his right
back of a length, closer to off stump, chopped to backward point
length ball turning in towards off and middle, clipped away through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, flat-batted down the ground to long-on
skips out of his crease and Jadeja bowls it full, at his feet. Clipped away to deep square leg
shortish, gets up to hip height on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
digs it in short outside off, gets it up to shoulder height, and Stoinis does very well to put that away, sees it early and swats it away, in the air but wide of mid-on

bam. Full and outside off and Stoinis smacks it back down the ground with the full face showing. A half-chance for Shami, had to stretch his left arm out to catch it at about chest height. Only got his fingertips to it, though
and he gets him next ball. Shortish outside off, doesn't climb as high as Stoinis expects as he goes for the pull. Only manages a bottom edge through to Dhoni
Shami greets him with a bouncer rising over off stump. Ducks down low to get under it
another bouncer, sharper one this time. Maxwell gets across his crease and just about manages to get his front shoulder out of the way
flat, speared into the pads, clipped off the front foot to square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away to the right of the diving square leg fielder
back of a length on off stump, punched to deep point
length ball turning into the pads, worked to square leg
shot. Jadeja had tucked him up for room right through this over. Finally he gets one outside off, and can free his arms. Gets on the front foot and slog-sweeps powerfully to the wide long-on boundary
flat again, on middle stump, clipped to straight midwicket
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently to the right of backward point

oh my, top edge, and four lucky runs for Maxwell. Digs it in short again, outside off, and Maxwell has to jump up to make any sort of contact with his attempted hook. The top edge loops over Dhoni and rolls down to the boundary
in the blockhole close to off stump, jabs down on it and squeezes it to the right of backward point
length ball on the stumps, shuffles across and clips it to deep square leg
another yorker, angling into middle stump. Digs it out, plays it back to the bowler
length ball turning in towards off stump, defended to midwicket
flat, fullish on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
fired in quick on off stump, spotted Marsh premeditating and hanging back. Forced to jam down quickly on it to defend
down the track now and Jadeja again fires it in full, at his feet. Whipped to midwicket
down the track again, slows it down this time on a middle-and-leg line. Driven to long-on
flat outside off, opens his bat face to stab into the backward point region
shortish, turning down leg, and Maxwell helps it away towards the fine leg boundary. Karthik chases it all the way from square leg to stop it near the boundary

floated up slow outside off, makes a bit of room and slashes it away nicely to the left of backward point. The sweeper on that boundary sprinted hard to his right and put in a sprawling drive, but to no avail
down the track and Kuldeep straightens his line, jabbed back to the bowler

and there's the hundred, lovely innings from Marsh, this, his seventh ODI hundred. Down the track, typically, to get there. Flighted ball outside off and he drives it to long-off to bring up the landmark
shortish googly, not much turn. Just goes with the angle towards off stump. Goes deep in his crease to pull to deep midwicket
shortish outside off, chopped to the left of backward point, where Jadeja gets to the ball in a flash to cut off the single
length ball angling in towards off stump, jabbed away to the left of mid-off
slower ball, back of a length, angling across to off stump. Waits on it and dabs to third man
length ball close to off stump, creates some inward angle by going wide of the crease. Maxwell blocks to short extra-cover
full on middle stump, whipped away to deep square leg
in the blockhole on middle and off, makes a bit of room and squeezes it away through cover point
fullish on off stump, Maxwell plays a checked drive to extra-cover
once again, a touch short outside off, and Marsh slaps up his thousandth single to the off-side sweeper off Kuldeep

bam! That's marginally short on off stump, and Maxwell is back in a flash. Slowness of the pitch helps too, and the slowness of Kuldeep. Swivels powerfully through the hips to pull it away, high over the midwicket boundary
flatter, the flipper/slider out of the front of the hand, on middle and off. Maxwell gets forward and shows the full face to pick up a single to long-off
flights it now, outside off, and Marsh steps out and lofts it inside-out, easily clears the wide long-off boundary. Not the greatest over from Kuldeep, this
short outside off, slapped to deep point
short on off and middle, rocks back and pulls along the ground to the left of deep square leg
117kph, chest high slower, Maxwell is back and hammering a pull shot to the short square boundary!
140kph, length into leg, he went to flip this over the short square boundary as well, got a thick inside edge onto pad

Given LBW! Maxwell reviews. Was this sliding down? It was fired into full and angling leg side. He tried to whip and was beaten for pace. Nothing on hot spot. Nothing on RTS. No bat involved. Ball tracking says missing leg stump! Not out. Good review from Maxwell
139kph, full and wide, Maxwell backs away reaches out with one hand and slices this past backward point and away to the rope! What a shot!
139kph, low full toss, inside edge onto pad, it rolls past off stump to short third man
full toss wide of off, Marsh cracks a cover-drive, smoking it past the man in the circle to the rope! Easy pickings.
138kph, full toss on off, he steps outside leg and lofts this up and over cover! Incredible hands to slice it into the gap! Deliberately done
127kph, slower ball, length outside off, he goes leg side again but misses. Maxwell yells at himself for missing that
122kph, slower ball, follows him down leg as he backs away, he glances in the air just short of short fine! They get one as the fielder knocks it down
length on leg, 131kph, and Marsh pumps this over the short boundary way back into the stands at square leg! A gift from Shami. Marsh says thank you!
wide half-volley he cracks a square drive firmly to deep point
136kph, thigh high full toss, he sits back and whips this with a flourish behind square
118kph, slower ball, right on the guideline outside off, Maxwell backs away but the umpire calls wide! Unlucky there. Not sure that was a wide
117kph, length slower ball, he carves it to deep cover-point, Maxwell calls two and takes on the throw and beats it easily!
wide yorker, well bowled, slides under the bat outside off
115kph, slower ball wide of off, Maxwell swings very hard and misses. Beautifully bowled. Deceived for pace
116kph, length slower ball wide of off, he toes a cut shot to cover, runs with the stroke a misfield on the circle means there's no run out chance
121kph, length ball in the slot, Marsh clears the right leg and heaves this way over deep square into the Members! Right in the hitting arc and he cashed in
136kph, full on middle, he drives back past the bowler, straight of long on and they get an easy two
wide half-volley, he carves this in the air towards the man at deep point and it's just short of him running in, they get two
dropped by Rohit Sharma at cover! Almost a freakish catch! It was crushed at cover, Rohit threw his right hand up above his head, it almost stuck, he had three bites at it but couldn't hold on!
full outside off, he lofts a cover-drive straight if the man in the deep
138kph, low full toss, he sits back and whips this through midwicket and the timing is good enough to beat wide long on running around!
141kph, bouncer, outside off, he tries to upper cut and misses, it's not called for height. Well bowled
full into middle and leg, he whips this out through midwicket to the sweeper
118kph, wide half-volley, outside the wide line, he jumps out and slaps it to cover. Would have been a wide if he'd let it go
135kph, yorker speared in at leg stump, he clips this out through square leg

caught at deep long off! Undone by a 119kph slower ball. It was a good length and wide, Maxwell tried to loft this over cover, but he dragged it to long off, DK stands 15 metres in off the rope and takes the catch easily
117kph, slower ball, angled wide off, he let it go thinking it might have been a wide but it was just inside the guideline. Well bowled

caught at long off! Bhuvi does it again with a slower ball! Good length slower ball outside off, Marsh lofts this towards long off but doesn't nail it, Jadeja, like DK, camps 15 metres in off the rope and takes the easy catch! Superb innings from Marsh ends with 13 balls remaining
136kph, full on off, he pushes this to cover and goes with the stroke
139kph, yorker on off, he clears the left leg and squeezes this out to cover
off cutter slower ball, 118kph, outside off, he tries to square drive but misses
122kph, length slower ball over middle, he backs away, tries to play it as it grips off the surface but misses again
141kph, yorker on middle, he digs this out towards long on

Missed run out! 131kph, yorker, perfectly executed, he blocks it and runs, Shami gathers as Lyon runs into him, he looks up and throws at the striker's but misses by miles! Maybe stunned by the knock on the head from Lyon!
caught at deep point! Another length off cutter slower ball wide off, he reaches out and slices this high to deep backward point, Shikhar Dhawan waits under it and takes the catch comfortably.

caught by Kohli on the run at deep backward point! 4 for 3! Great running catch! Another length slower ball outside off, Siddle slices a drive high to deep backward point, Kohli has to sprint off the rope to get there and he catches it at full stretch, running at top pace!
135kph, yorker, on off, he digs this out to midwicket for a single
135kph, full into middle, he turns this out through midwicket
brilliant flick over short fine! 116kph, length slower ball outside off, Lyon picks it, steps outside off and flicks this up and over short fine leg! Super shot
118kph, slower ball outside off, he stands and slogs this time but misses

launched over midwicket 20 rows back! Wow! Lyon gets him! Bhuvneshwar missed his spot, slower ball outside off, but it was the perfect hitting length, he stepped across and slogged this high over midwicket and got all of it!
fullish to start, just a hint of swing to straighten it towards middle stump, clipped towards midwicket, who dives right to stop it
some more swing, this time starts too straight and is definitely missing leg stump. Looks to flick and the ball beats his inside edge and thuds into pad
nice length, swerving into middle and leg. Watches it nicely, keeps his front pad out of the way, and clips gently to midwicket
back of a length outside off, Rohit leaves it alone. Threatened to come back in but eventually just kept going with the angle
fullish on off stump, transfers his weight forward into a checked drive to mid-off
length ball slanting away into the fifth-stump channel. Left alone and Behrendorff begins with a maiden

lovely ball to start with, on the fuller side of a good length and straightening back late into Dhawan's off and middle stumps. Keeps his front leg out of the way, brings down a straight bat, and picks up a single wide of mid-on to get off the mark in the series
back of a length outside off, defended into the point region

shortish outside off, only gets up to about hip high because it wasn't that short at all, but Rohit pounces on anything marginally in that region and he pulls it away nicely, into the gap between mid-on and midwicket
length ball sliding down leg. Misses the flick and the ball tickles front pad on its way to the keeper
short, wide, and Rohit presses half-forward and just extends his arms out to play a straight-bat punch to beat third man to his right. Made it look so easy
full now, in the sixth-stump channel with a bit of late outswing. Watches it well and leaves it alone

nicely bowled, beautiful length and late swing away from a fourth-stump line. Dhawan presses forward, watches it all the way, and leaves it, shaping to defend and pulling his bat inside the line at the last moment
full now, on middle and off, jams his bat down to squeeze it towards mid-on
length ball slanting into leg stump. No swing this time. Dhawan plays across the line, looking to flick, and inside-edges into his front pad
fullish and wide outside off, reaches out and slashes it away, to the right of backward point. Richardson chases around to his left from third man to make a good stop

back of a length on middle stump - keeps going with the angle rather than swinging back in as Rohit expected, and he's squared up a little and pops it off the outside half of the bat towards cover. Briefly in the air
back of a length, and once again the lack of inswing confounds Rohit. Squares him up again, on the back foot this time, and slides past his outside edge
full outside off, slanting across from over the wicket. Doesn't really time his drive, rolls out slowly to point
full, swings into the pads, and Dhawan whips it away beautifully. Places it perfectly too, beats square leg to his left and leaves fine leg with way too much distance to cover in the other direction
ooh, that's a little wild from Dhawan. Slants this across the stumps, again quite full, and Dhawan plays for the inswing and looks to hoick this over mid-on cross-batted. Ends up missing completely
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length, swings away after starting fairly wide of off stump, straightforward leave for Rohit
back of a length, no swing, just ends up at Dhawan's front thigh pad and he helps it away to the fine leg boundary, past the diving keeper. Not sure if he got any bat on it, in fact
full this time, on off stump, ends up looking to hit it square, through cover point, playing for swing, and it doesn't swing. He's lucky to get a thick inside edge that rolls into the leg side
down the track now, Behrendorff pulls his length back slightly along an off-stump line. Swings across the line and swats it away through midwicket, off the inside half of the bat
shot! That's a wide half-volley alright, but how well did he hit that? Down on his back knee, frees his arms, and creams it to the left of the diving cover fielder
full again, not quite as full this time, doesn't get the same power on his drive this time, hits it to the man at cover
full on middle and leg, clipped away to the right of fine leg. Dhawan jams his bat into the turf while completing his second run, and nearly gets into a tangle with his feet as a result
back of a length, angling into the legs. Tucked off the hip into the backward square leg region

full, wide, four. He's going for his shots today, hasn't been afraid of throwing his bat at the wide ones. He's leaning back this time, not necessarily looking to get his weight forward and play along the ground. Ends up slicing it, but powerfully, in the air to the right of the diving backward point fielder
length ball outside off, punched on the up and Lyon saves four with a dive to his right at cover point

back of a length, keeps going with the angle towards middle stump. Goes back and looks to work it into the leg side, closing his bat face too early. Hits him on the back pad, but pretty high, and Richardson's appeal isn't the most confident
looks to angle it into the stumps again, ends up overdoing it and whanging it down the leg side
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and opens his bat face for a gentle dab to third man
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
full outside off, squeezed out to backward point, who stops it with a dive to his left

back of a length, close to off stump. Doesn't get the width he wants - he was staying next to the line and looking to carve through the point region. Denied room, all he can do is chop it down gently into the off side
length ball, a little wider, slapped to cover point
full on off stump, and Dhawan drives to the left of the newly stationed sweeper
shortish, leg-stumpish, Dhawan swivels round and pulls it to the left of short fine leg. Hardly the field to be bowling even remotely short to
length ball wide of off stump, driven crisply on the up to sweeper cover
back of a length, tucked off the hip into the fine leg region
full, swinging in from about leg stump, can't connect with the flick but gets enough pad on it to pick up a leg bye into the backward square leg region
short outside off, and Dhawan loves it there. Plays a sensational shot too, hits deliberately underneath it, with a straight bat, up and over cover

and that is that. He's played with a lot of freedom today, but now he's played one shot too many. Length ball, angling into off stump, not quite full enough for the pick-up shot over midwicket. Plays too early, and ends up spooning it high in the air, off the outside half of the bat. Khawaja takes a steepler backtracking from mid-off
back of a length, swings in to beat Rohit's flick and hit his front pad, but it pitched outside leg
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and chops it down to third man
length ball angling in towards off stump, clipped into the leg side and midwicket dives left to stop it
back of a length, close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to third man
Siddle throws in the wide tempter - go on, play that cover drive, he says, but Kohli judges the length well, knows it's not full enough, and leaves it alone
now he goes full and straight, looking to hit front pad or off stump, and Kohli plays around that front pad to whip it round to fine leg. Hands-on-head time for Siddle
gorgeous shot. Again a fullish ball angling into off stump. Just shows the full face and eases a drive to the left of mid-on
full outside off, and Kohli takes a big step forward and across and uses his wrists to whip it to mid-on. Unusual for him to do that so early in his innings, from so far outside off stump
back of a length, slanting away from off stump. Gives Rohit just enough room to free his arms and punch between backward point and cover

once again plays for swing when there is none. Lovely length, and Rohit is stuck on the crease trying to whip it across the line. Beats the outside edge, hits thigh pad, and rolls to the right of the keeper
extra bounce, and this time it does swing back in. Goes back to play that flick again, and this time it beats the inside edge to hit him on the thigh pad
length ball slanting across towards off stump, doesn't really get forward, just shuffles across and defends into the covers
nice length, angling across the stumps, draws Rohit forward for a defensive push to mid-off

beauty. He knows Rohit is tentative and is expecting that late inswing. There hasn't been much swing in this over. Fullish, not quite a half-volley, fairly wide of off stump, and it beats the outside edge as Rohit goes for the cover drive without getting a proper front-foot stride in
back of a length to start, goes right back to work it into the backward square leg region
tossed up full on off stump, clipped away neatly to wide long-on
floated up fairly full, just outside off, driven to long-on
length ball, slides on with the angle towards off stump. Rohit wants to work it away behind square, but the lack of turn forces him to play it in front of square, defensively
a touch shorter, rocks back and punches through cover point
flatter on off stump, goes right back to punch this to midwicket
back of a length outside off. Rohit gets half-forward and steers it to third man
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, presses forward and defends towards point
length ball close to off stump, defended watchfully towards backward point

back of a length, just a touch of width, and that's enough for Kohli. The extra fielder on the leg side means there's no cover point, and Kohli stands up tall and punches with a straight bat into that gap. Cover gives chase, to no avail
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
length ball slanting across to off stump. Stays on the back foot and clips to midwicket
stays back again, works this from middle stump to the left of short fine leg
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked off the hip to square leg
again not full enough to draw the batsman forward. Kohli goes deep in his crease and across to work this from middle stump to deep backward square leg
tossed up slower now, just outside off, stretches out to defend it back to the bowler
shot! That's a good-length ball, but it's just wide enough outside off for Rohit to step back, get down low, and cut it away through backward point
full, angling into off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on

wow. That's just the stock ODI delivery from the fast bowler, back of a length, angling into off stump. Rohit steps half-forward and across, and brings his wrists into play for a pick-up shot that easily clears the square leg boundary
length ball outside off, punched into the covers
back of a length outside off, guided down to third man with an open face
glorious. Fullish, angling into off stump, and Kohli plays that full-faced front-foot punch to send it whooshing past the left hand of the diving mid-on fielder

length ball outside off, and there's nearly a mix-up between these two notorious mixers-up between wickets. Presses forward, jabs it safely to the left of backward point, and then hesitates midway through a straightforward single. But they get their bearings right quickly and complete it comfortably
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on past the diving bowler
length ball outside off, stays on the back foot, slightly besides the line, and punches to sweeper cover
length ball close to off stump, goes back and across to clip towards square leg
tossed up slow outside off. Kohli stretches out, looking to clip to long-on, but midwicket dives left to intercept
back of a length on middle stump, goes right back in his crease to whip it to deep square leg

length ball on middle stump, clips it to the right of midwicket - not too far from the fielder - and hares out of his crease. Kohli, rightly, sends him back, and Rohit has to dive to regain his crease
length ball on off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on
length ball outside off, Kohli stretches out to push into the cover point region. Backward point sprints out of his station quickly to cut off the single
length ball close to off stump, punched away to deep point
in the blockhole, angling into middle stump, gets his front leg out of the way to clip it past the left hand of the diving midwicket fielder. Was briefly, and tantalisingly, in the air too
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
length ball, close to off stump. Lets it come on and taps it on its head to send it rolling away to third man
93kph, good length angled across, outside off, he late cuts, but a piece of glove on it slows it down
shorter outside off, he just pushes to backward point
tossed higher and slower outside off, he defends with soft hands close towards point and they get a quick one
shorter on leg, he's back and working this off the hip through square leg
tossed up in the arc, Rohit steps out and launches this sumptuously over midwicket, picking the gap and clearing the rope! His bat swing is so smooth.
92kph, good length on off, he turns it around the corner for a single
124kph, off cutter, he leans into a lovely drive past cover, straight of deep point for two
125kph, good length outside off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
129kph, back of a length outside off, he's on the front foot but pulls with control around the corner down to fine leg
131kph, outswinger wide of off, he plays a controlled square drive to deep point

caught at deep forward square! Rohit makes an error! Just short of a length, Rohit wants to pull this over the short square boundary, he gets under it but gets top edge, it flies to deep forward square, Handscomb runs in and to his left, looking straight into the setting sun, he takes a good catch and celebrates!
133kph, good length on off, he pushes on the front foot, gets a thick edge that runs along the ground to third man
good length on middle, 90kph, he's back and working to square leg
flatter, 91kph, on off, he's back and defending
89kph, good length, on off, he's back and punching, just past the diving Lyon to long on
92kph, off break on leg, he works this off the front foot to midwicket
skips down to a length ball, 87kph, he is forced to defend on the move
91kph, pushed through flatter on off, he defends off the back foot
131kph, fuller on off, he plays a drive with the full face to mid off
131kph, good length outside off, he square drives on the up to deep cover-point
132kph, shorter and wider, he cuts but doesn't time it to point
129kph, good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave this alone
131kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across defending to cover
131kph, good length outside off, he presses forward and opens the face and runs it fine, third man is in the circle! Well controlled by Rayudu. Certainly appeared a deliberate stroke.
90kph, good length on middle, he defends from the crease
92kph, fuller on off, he defends again from the crease
89kph off break on leg, he turns this around the corner to short fine leg for one
94kph, good length on leg, he clips this to square midwicket
good length down leg, it comes off pad as he tries to pull, ricochets off Carey's pad and rolls away
fuller on leg, he clips this through square leg with the slight turn to deep square
131kph, good length outside off, he pushes a drive on the up through cover-point to the sweeper
good length on middle and off, he defends on the front foot
back of a length outside off, he's back and defending towards point
shorter and wider, he tries to cut, gets a thick bottom edge, it bounces behind him but away from the stumps, he did follow it to ensure it didn't go near the stumps
shorter length, rib high, he swivels on a controlled pull shot through square leg to the sweeper
115kph, slower ball, outside off, he drives with ease through the cover-point gap to the man in the deep
135kph, full on the pads and he pings this off his toes through midwicket along the ground and the deep square sweeper has run around to save it
137kph, wide of off, he slices a square drive to wide third man
139kph, leg cutter outside off, he pushes at a drive away from his body and it beaten
136kph, back of a length wide of off, he drives on the up, gets a thick edge that flies through the vacant slips! It races away. Well bowled. Unjust for Siddle
139kph, good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot
123kph, slower ball outside off, he square drives straight to backward point
129kph, bouncer, Kohli was moving forward went to pull but bailed out. Stoinis smiles and gives cheeky word
131kph, good length outside off, he is back and knocking this with soft hands to third man
131kph, good length on off, he drives on the up, firmly to cover but can't beat the man
130kph, short ball, he pulls but miscues, it flies high in the air but safely over midwicket and they pick up two
132kph, full and wide, he scoops this in the air, just past Maxwell at backward point, wasn't far away but it goes safely to wide third man
128kph fuller on off, he pushes on the front foot back to the bowler
88kph, good length on middle, he defends on the front foot into the leg side
shorter on middle, he's back and pulling but can't beat the man at square leg inside the circle
tossed up outside off, he drives firmly straight of deep cover-point, they push for two but it's not on as Handscomb gets around
down the leg side, he tries to sweep and misses, Carey can't take it cleanly, they get another extra
tossed up on leg, he clips this through midwicket to the sweeper
92kph, on off, he skips down and clips this to long on
shorter on leg, he's back and glancing this fine, he sprints looking for a second but Behrendorff was quick to the ball
138kph, fuller length angled into off, he slips this with the angle to midwicket
shorter outside off, he plays a controlled late cut to third man
137kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he defends from the crease to point
135kph, shorter outside off, he stands up and guides this down to third man
140kph, half-volley leg stump, clipped magnificently through midwicket, timed superbly, Handscomb makes a great diving save on the rope to stop the boundary
119kph slower ball short and wide, he cuts hard but straight to the man at deep point
shorter outside off, he's back and cutting hard forward of point, Handscomb again has to work hard to cut it off on the rope
good length on leg, he is back and glancing this to fine leg
86kph outside off, he reaches out and sweeps in the air but not far enough to reach Stoinis on the full at deep square
tossed up on off, he drives back to the bowler
good length on leg, he tucks this behind square
he skips down and is beaten in flight, he checks his shot and defends to cover, nowhere near the pitch of the ball
134kph, fuller length, he plays a glorious straight drive and the stumps at the non-striker's saves several runs at least!
137kph, shorter outside off, he runs this down to third man easily
139kph, he charges a short ball, pulls in the air with no control, high and wide of fine leg, Khawaja gets there on the bounce
140kph, fuller and he pushes firmly back to the bowler
good length outside off, he drives on the up to point
140kph, back of a length wide of off, he cracks a square cut to deep cover-point
full on middle and off, he clips this firmly past midwicket, Stoinis comes in, Rayudu pushes for two and Kohli sends him back loudly!
shorter on leg, 94kph, he swings a pull hard behind square to the sweeper
short and pulled in the air wide of Finch at midwicket, out to the sweeper on the rope
shorter outside off, he tries to cut and chops a bottom edge into the off side
shorter on leg, he's back and pulling hard to deep square
full angled down leg, he tries to sweep, it comes off glove and bounces into the off side
140kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
137kph, length ball outside off, he charges down and stays leg side, slicing this up and over cover, not well timed but he gets a couple. 50 partnership up
141kph, good length outside off, he premeditated a back and across movement, and had to defend late
he charges again and slices a flat batted strike down the ground over mid off, doesn't time it pitches and stops well short of the rope
120kph, slower ball outside off, he defends with soft hands to short third man
140kph, back of a length, outside off, he runs off the face down to third man
89kph shorter outside off, he runs this fine off the face down to third man and gets two. 50 for Kohli. Doesn't acknowledge it
shorter down leg, he glances fine of fine leg for a couple more
tossed up on leg, he drives firmly to long on

caught at deep midwicket! The pressure got to him! He skips down and tries to launch this with the spin high over midwicket, it was a touch slower, he got underneath it and skied it high to deep midwicket, Stoinis camped under it and took the catch!
shorter on leg, he is back and working this to square leg
shorter length, he's back and pulling forward of square to the sweeper
127kph, back of a length angled across him, he defends on the walk, it nipped away a touch and he had to check his attempt to work to leg
shorter outside off, 126kph, he is back and running this with the angle to third man
shorter outside off, he cuts nicely past backward point wide of third man and they get two
132kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot
129kph, cutter back of a length outside off, he defends from the crease to cover
shorter length outside off, 129kph, he's back and across and working this around the corner to fine leg
89kph tossed up on off, he defends on the front foot to midwicket
shorter length, he pulls around the corner to square leg in the circle
tossed up on off, he turns this off the front foot to midwicket
flatter on leg, he turns this with the spin to square leg
round arm, slung into middle, he defends back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, he pushes this to the gap at cover-point
131kph, back of a length on off, he's back and tucking this behind square for one
131kph, good length outside off, he drives on the up through cover-point straight of the sweeper
short and wide and he cracks a punch off the back foot with power through cover, beats the sweeper this time! Finally a boundary for Kohli. Here we go
good length on off, 130kph, he turns this on the front foot to midwicket
Boom over long on! Out of nowhere! This was overpitched outside off, mid on is up, he whips his hands through the line and lofts this high over the long boundary!
back of a length outside off, he's back and smoking a cut shot straight to deep point. He yells in anger that he didn't get it wide of the sweeper
tossed up outside off, he drives with a strong bottom hand to long on
shorter outside off, he's back and finessing this with a flick through cover-point
drifting outside off, he uses the pace and dabs this fine of short third man! It runs away to the rope! Kohli has flicked the switch
shorter on middle, 89kph, he's back and tucking this around the corner
tossed up outside off, he skips down and defends back to Lyon
pushed through outside, he's back but forcing this to cover
drifts onto Kohli's legs and he tickles it away into the fine-leg region
once again, angling it down leg slightly. Misses the flick and is hit on the front pad
length ball on off stump. Pokes it to point and thinks of a single, but it's going straight to the fielder at a pretty decent pace
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to nurdle it into the square leg region
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot and jabs to point
back of a length outside off, stabbed away to the left of the diving cover fielder and they run two while deep point runs to his right to tidy up

down the track to the flighted ball on off stump and Kohli hits it into the safest region possible. Skips inside the line to make himself a tiny bit of room, and hits it high and dead straight, back over the umpire's head, and it thuds into the sightscreen
wider now, presses forward to drive to extra-cover

not short by any means, just a length ball outside off, rocks back, deep in his crease, and carves it away to the left of the man at deep point, forcing Handscomb into a sprawling save by the boundary
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away to the left of long leg
flat length ball on the pads, clipped to short fine leg
once again, a flat length ball, on middle and leg, this time he works it away to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched to cover
fullish outside off, stretches out and drives to cover point
shuffles down the pitch and Stoinis bangs it in short. Pulled along the ground to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

shout for lbw as Kohli takes a big step forward and across and looks to work it into the leg side from a stump-to-stump line. Hit high on the thigh pad - probably premeditated there, against a ball he should have gone back to

short, just a bit of width, and Kohli jumps to ride the bounce and play a shot he isn't normally known for, the square cut. Flashes to the left of the man at backward point, and third man has no chance. Into the 90s now
length ball angling into off stump, clips it to the right of mid-on and hurries through to the other end
fullish on off stump, clipped away crisply to the right of mid-on, who has to put in a sprawling dive to keep it down to two
banged in short, gets it up to shoulder height. Rolls his wrists over the pull to play it along the ground to deep square leg
full, almost in the blockhole, on middle stump. Clipped to midwicket
bouncer, rising fairly steeply over off stump. Dhoni watches it well, gets across it, and ducks under
back of a length on off stump, nice use of the wrists to work it through square leg
shortish on off stump, shuffles across and whips it to midwicket
shortish outside off, stops on Kohli a little. Wanted to punch it through the covers, ended up hitting it towards mid-on off the inside half of the bat
back of a length, close to off stump, watches it well and guides it down to third man
back of a length close to off stump, punched with a straight bat to the left of mid-off, not far enough to his left to pick up one
another bouncer, Dhoni ducks under it
full on off stump, punched back to the bowler, who spots Dhoni briefly out of his crease and flings a throw to the other end. Misses the stumps, though
full on off stump, steps forward and across and whips this to deep square leg

down the track and Siddle sees him coming. Bangs it in and gets it to rise towards his chest. Dhoni spins around and sends a miscontrolled pull soaring towards the fielder at long leg, but Behrendorff, diving forward, can't quite get to the ball before it lands
short again, angling into Dhoni's left ribcage. Pulled along the ground this time to long leg
bouncer, climbs loopily, well over Kohli's head, before dropping down tennis-ball style into Carey's gloves
short, wide, sits up nicely for Kohli to cut. The sweeper on the cover point boundary runs quickly to his left and pulls off a sliding stop. Handscomb, I think
another loopy bouncer, Dhoni barely has to duck to get under it
back of a length outside off, gets across to get close to the line and pokes it to the left of cover
steps out of his crease and across to the off side to a fullish ball from Siddle. Looks to flick from well outside off stump, gets a thick outside edge to short third man

that's super running. Back of a length, angling slightly down leg. Shuffles across and misses the flick, and the ball drops down by Dhoni's feet, to his left, after hitting his pad. Just one bit of eye contact across the pitch is enough for both batsmen to steal a hurried leg-bye
back of a length, close to off stump, opens his bat face to dab to backward point

ooh, that's a rare uncontrolled hoick from Kohli. Fullish, on off stump, looks to whip it over the leg side and gets a thick edge that nearly carries all the way to third man. Lands about three or four feet in front of him
back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-off and he finds Finch a touch too deep and on his heels
back of a length outside off, looks for the dab to third man but backward point moves quickly to intercept
shortish outside off, swatted down the ground with a horizontal bat, bounces down to long-on

And there it is, shuffles across to tuck this back-of-a-length delivery from a fifth-stump line to the fielder at deep square leg. Hundred number 39. THIRTY NINE! Here I was thinking he was still somewhere in the mid-to-high 20s. Wow. Not much of a celebration, just a fist pump. Keeps his helmet on too.
in the blockhole on middle and off, clipped to the right of deep square leg
slower bouncer wide outside off, Dhoni leaves it alone

great running. Back of a length, fifth-stump line. Dhoni jumps across and uses his wrists to work it into the vacant mid-on region, and both batsmen knew as soon as he made contact that two runs were on
length ball on off stump, presses forward and shows the full face to send it rolling past the diving bowler towards long-on

full on middle stump, and Kohli chips it in the air - not sure if it was intentional - on the bounce to long-on. I think he was looking to flick it more through midwicket, and ended up checking his shot
in the blockhole on leg stump, steps across to clip to the left of long leg
length ball on off stump, clipped quietly to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, stands utterly still until the ball reaches him, and jabs it away to the right of third man
slower ball, back of a length, on middle stump. Dhoni shuffles across and nurdles it into the midwicket region. No one saving one on the leg side

whoopsie. A huge moment for Australia, this. This is full, a half-volley on leg stump, and I don't know if Kohli was looking to hit this in the air, but he's flicked it, possibly a touch earlier than he wanted to, timed it perhaps better than he wanted to, and picked out the fielder at deep midwicket. With everyone back on the leg side, I doubt this was intentional
shortish, rising towards Karthik's ribcage. Jumps across and tucks it into the backward square leg region
length ball on middle stump, worked away to deep backward square leg
flat, leg-stumpish. Shuffles across to try and work it behind square, and he misses. Ball hits his thigh pad
down the track now and Lyon bowls it on Dhoni's pad, flicked to the right of deep midwicket
bam! Down the track and Lyon feeds him just where he wants the ball. A bit of flight, and outside off stump, and he can free his arms and hoick it away, with the turn, over the wide long-on boundary
flat length ball sliding on towards off stump, clipped back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, makes room and forces it past extra-cover diving left, and picks up two more
flighted and full on off stump, brings out that trademark straight-bat bottom-hand push to long-on to retain the strike
back of a length, angling into Dhoni's left hip. Tucked away to long leg
full on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and nudges it away through backward square leg

short, gets it up to shoulder height over off stump, and how good a shot is that from DK? Steps back and across, swivels, rolls his wrists over, and finds the  gap to the right of deep square leg, nearly hooks it for six. Bounces just a foot or so short of the rope
length ball on off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on

back of a length, gets his line all wrong. With pretty much everyone in the circle on the off side, he doesn't want to give Dhoni any width, and he ends up whanging it down the leg side. Dhoni merely steps across and shoulders arms
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to tuck it through square leg
full, angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler. I guess he was looking for the single to long-on but hit it straighter than intended
full outside off, opens his bat face slightly to ease it past the left-hand of the diving extra-cover fielder
low full-toss outside off, punches it with a straight bat to the left of long-off
don't bowl short to Dinesh Karthik. Not today, at least. Sits up on an off-stump line, and he hits it up and over, into the gap between long leg and deep forward square leg
length ball outside off, driven to extra-cover

length ball on off stump, looks like the offcutter. Clips it down the ground, doesn't put too much weight behind his shot, and they can pick up two by the time long-on sprints forward and to his right to get to it
back of a length, slanting across into a fourth-stump line. Lots of bottom hand in that whip to deep midwicket
loopy slower full-toss outside off, swatted down the ground to long-on. Managed to get some proper dip on it
back of a length, off-stumpish, worked away to deep midwicket off the back foot
another slower ball, full and fairly wide, driven to deep point
shortish, leg-stumpish, jumps across and nudges it away into the fine leg region. Strays in line and Dhoni picks up a clever three
shuffles out of his crease and gets a fullish ball on off stump. Clipped away neatly, once more into that midwicket region
down the track and Stoinis bangs it in short. Punches it with a straight bat to long-off
fullish outside off, driven past the diving extra-cover's left hand, and to the right of sweeper cover
length ball on middle stump, shows the full face to drive to long-on
back of a length on off stump, and Dhoni jabs it gently in front of extra-cover, a couple of yards to his right, and hustles through for a quick single

someone asked where all the scoop shots were - here it is. Slower length ball outside off, and Karthik steps across and helps it nice and fine. There's no one at short fine leg, and the man at fine leg is quite wide, more long leg than fine leg. And that placement allows these batsmen to run three.
fullish on off stump, and Dhoni goes for the big hit down the ground. Hits it pretty well, but straight to long-on, on the bounce

probably not. Back of a length on off stump, and MS Dhoni absolutely Dhonies this to bring up his fifty. Leans back, clears his front leg, and brings all that bottom-hand power into play to clear long-on as well. It'll be an interesting exercise to work out how many times he's hit this ball - 49.1 - for six in his ODI career

and there's the win. The field comes in, but there's still enough gaps to sneak that single. Full, close to off stump, and Dhoni clips it just wide of mid-on and hurries through to the other end. 2018 wasn't a great year for Dhoni. He's begun 2019 with two fifties in a row, the second one a vintage Dhoni chasing innings
